fields.name: document_title
fields.value: Policy Features and Benefits May Vary By State

fields.name: main_section_header
fields.value: FEATURES & BENEFITS AVAILABLE WITH BOTH SIMPLE ADVANTAGE™ AND CUSTOM ADVANTAGE™

fields.name: Home and Community Care
fields.value: Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Home care services - Nursing Care, Therapy services, Care Advisory Services, Homemaker Services; Services provided by a Home Care Aide, Social Worker or Independent Caregiver; Hospice Care; Adult Day Care

fields.name: Facility Care
fields.value: Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Assisted Living Facility, Nursing Home, Hospice Facility

fields.name: Elimination Period
fields.value: 100 Calendar Days; Once per lifetime and cumulative

fields.name: Alternate Service Provision
fields.value: A MetLife Care Coordinator may authorize benefits for OLTC services not specifically defined as covered services under the policy, as long as the service meets the needs of the insured and is a cost-effective alternative.

fields.name: Bed Reservation
fields.value: Reimburses up to 50 days per calendar year for actual charges incurred, to reserve insured's bed in a facility for any reason

fields.name: Return of Premium
fields.value: If insured dies on or before his/her 70th birthday, 100% of premiums paid, minus any benefits paid or payable, will be returned to insured's beneficiary or estate

fields.name: International Benefit
fields.value: Pays a cash benefit equal to 50% of the MBA when the insured is outside the U.S.; TBA is limited to the lesser of: (1) TBA less benefits paid while insured is in the U.S.; or (2) 50% of TBA; EP for International Benefit is doubled to 200 Calendar Days; If Cash Benefit Rider is added to policy: International Benefit is modified; pays benefits outside US at 100% of MBA; EP will be 100 Calendar Days

fields.name: Contingent Benefit Upon Lapse
fields.value: Limited coverage if policy ends due to non-payment of premiums or insured's written request to cancel, following a substantial premium increase; Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of: the total amount of premium paid; or 1x MBA; Total benefits paid to insured will not exceed the TBA in effect immediately prior to the nonforfeiture date

fields.name: Initial Needs Assessment
fields.value: 1 visit per lifetime; EP does not need to be satisfied; If Care Management organization is selected by MetLife - no cost to the insured; If Care Management organization is selected by the insured - reimbursed up to $275 per lifetime

fields.name: Premium Waiver
fields.value: Premiums waived when EP is satisfied and the insured is receiving payment of benefits

fields.name: Coordination of Benefits
fields.value: Coordination of Benefits (COB) and non-duplication of coverage with other MetLife LTCI coverage and Medicare (COB and non-duplication of coverage not applicable with Cash Benefit Rider)

fields.name: additional_information_header
fields.value: ADDITIONAL INFORMATION FOR ALL POLICIES

fields.name: Payment Options
fields.value: Standard Pay: Annual, Semi-Annual, Quarterly, Monthly (EFT); 10 Year Premium Payment Rider - available at initial application only; N/A with FPO or GPO; May impact the tax deductibility of the premium; client should consult a tax advisor for further clarification

fields.name: Care Coordination Services
fields.value: MetLife Care Coordinators are available to answer questions about LTC coverage, services and discounts in the insured's area. An insured can also call for advice about caring for a loved one who needs LTC services, even if their family member is not insured with MetLife.

fields.name: Discounts
fields.value: 30% Spousal** - 15% Marital** - 15% Residential - 10% Preferred Health (N/A for insureds age 80 - 84) - 5% or 10% Multi-Life Discount for approved cases

fields.name: Underwriting Classes
fields.value: Preferred (N/A for insureds age 80 - 84), Standard & Substandard (Always quote Standard!)

fields.name: Policy Effective Dates
fields.value: With Premium (Conditional Receipt may apply): Date all underwriting requirements are met; Without Premium: 28 days following underwriting approval date

fields.name: Free Look Period
fields.value: Insured has 30 days to review policy and if desired, return it for a full refund

fields.name: Policy Delivery
fields.value: Policy Delivery Receipt (PDR) must be signed within 30 days of Policy Approval Date

fields.name: company_name_address
fields.value: Metropolitan Life Insurance Company, New York, NY 10166

notes: Document appears to be an insurance product brochure (MetLife LTC LifeStage Advantage) containing plan features and benefits. No facility invoice, CMR form, or UB04 provider/billing fields were found in the provided OCR data.

All extracted content in the aggregated input corresponds to plan descriptions, tables of benefits, and company address; therefore no canonical invoice/claim fields (policyNumber, invoiceNumber, totals, service dates, signatures, etc.) could be populated.

prompt.system:
You are building canonical data for illumifin claims processing. You are given OCR extraction results (fields and tables) for a multi-page document along with page-level document type hints. Classify the overall content into one or more of: 'facility_invoice', 'cmr_form', 'ub04'. Input JSON includes a pages array where each page has fields with IDs, values, and normalized bounding boxes (x, y, width, height all between 0 and 1 relative to the page). When populating sources, always reference the provided field IDs (fieldId) or table IDs (tableId) and include the page number. Table metadata includes column headers/keys and cell-level bounding boxes; include the column name when pointing to table sources. Then produce a JSON object matching this schema exactly: {
  "generatedAt": ISO8601 timestamp,
  "documentTypes": [string],
  "facilityInvoice": { optional, object with keys "general" (dict of canonical field name -> value object) and "lineItems" (list of dict canonicalName->value object) },
  "cmrForm": { optional, similar structure with sections },
  "ub04": { optional, provider fields },
  "notes": [string]
 }.
Each canonical value object must be of form {"value": string or null, "confidence": number 0-1, "sources": [ {"page": int optional, "fieldId": string optional, "tableId": string optional, "column": string optional } ] }. Confidence is your mapping confidence (not OCR confidence). Populate as many facility invoice fields as possible: policyNumber, policyholderName, policyholderAddress, providerName, providerAddress, invoiceNumber, invoiceDate, taxId, totalAmount, balanceDue, credits. For lineItems include description, startDate, endDate, unitType, quantity, amount, balance, totalDue, credits. For CMR include policyNumber, policyholderName, policyholderAddress, providerName, providerAddress, serviceFrom, serviceThrough, careLevelSelection, absenceIndicator (yes/no) plus absenceDetails (departureDate, returnDate, reason, admissionDate, dischargeDate), insuranceIndicator and insuranceSelections (medicare, medicaid, other), signaturePresent (yes/blank) and signatureDate. For UB04 include providerName, providerAddress. Always provide an empty object for a section if it applies but data is missing. If no content applies, set documentTypes to ['other'] and return empty sections. Do not invent data. Leave value as null when evidence is absent. Provide reasoning notes in the notes array when confidence is low.

fields.name: document_title
fields.value: Policy Features and Benefits May Vary By State

fields.name: main_section_header
fields.value: FEATURES & BENEFITS AVAILABLE WITH BOTH SIMPLE ADVANTAGE™ AND CUSTOM ADVANTAGE™

fields.name: Home and Community Care
fields.value: Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Home care services - Nursing Care, Therapy services, Care Advisory Services, Homemaker Services; Services provided by a Home Care Aide, Social Worker or Independent Caregiver; Hospice Care; Adult Day Care

fields.name: Facility Care
fields.value: Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Assisted Living Facility, Nursing Home, Hospice Facility

fields.name: Elimination Period
fields.value: 100 Calendar Days; Once per lifetime and cumulative

fields.name: Alternate Service Provision
fields.value: A MetLife Care Coordinator may authorize benefits for OLTC services not specifically defined as covered services under the policy, as long as the service meets the needs of the insured and is a cost-effective alternative.

fields.name: Bed Reservation
fields.value: Reimburses up to 50 days per calendar year for actual charges incurred, to reserve insured's bed in a facility for any reason

fields.name: Return of Premium
fields.value: If insured dies on or before his/her 70th birthday, 100% of premiums paid, minus any benefits paid or payable, will be returned to insured's beneficiary or estate

fields.name: International Benefit
fields.value: Pays a cash benefit equal to 50% of the MBA when the insured is outside the U.S.; TBA is limited to the lesser of: (1) TBA less benefits paid while insured is in the U.S.; or (2) 50% of TBA; EP for International Benefit is doubled to 200 Calendar Days; If Cash Benefit Rider is added to policy: International Benefit is modified; pays benefits outside US at 100% of MBA; EP will be 100 Calendar Days

fields.name: Contingent Benefit Upon Lapse
fields.value: Limited coverage if policy ends due to non-payment of premiums or insured's written request to cancel, following a substantial premium increase; Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of: the total amount of premium paid; or 1x MBA; Total benefits paid to insured will not exceed the TBA in effect immediately prior to the nonforfeiture date

fields.name: Initial Needs Assessment
fields.value: 1 visit per lifetime; EP does not need to be satisfied; If Care Management organization is selected by MetLife - no cost to the insured; If Care Management organization is selected by the insured - reimbursed up to $275 per lifetime

fields.name: Premium Waiver
fields.value: Premiums waived when EP is satisfied and the insured is receiving payment of benefits

fields.name: Coordination of Benefits
fields.value: Coordination of Benefits (COB) and non-duplication of coverage with other MetLife LTCI coverage and Medicare (COB and non-duplication of coverage not applicable with Cash Benefit Rider)

fields.name: additional_information_header
fields.value: ADDITIONAL INFORMATION FOR ALL POLICIES

fields.name: Payment Options
fields.value: Standard Pay: Annual, Semi-Annual, Quarterly, Monthly (EFT); 10 Year Premium Payment Rider - available at initial application only; N/A with FPO or GPO; May impact the tax deductibility of the premium; client should consult a tax advisor for further clarification

fields.name: Care Coordination Services
fields.value: MetLife Care Coordinators are available to answer questions about LTC coverage, services and discounts in the insured's area. An insured can also call for advice about caring for a loved one who needs LTC services, even if their family member is not insured with MetLife.

fields.name: Discounts
fields.value: 30% Spousal** - 15% Marital** - 15% Residential - 10% Preferred Health (N/A for insureds age 80 - 84) - 5% or 10% Multi-Life Discount for approved cases

fields.name: Underwriting Classes
fields.value: Preferred (N/A for insureds age 80 - 84), Standard & Substandard (Always quote Standard!)

fields.name: Policy Effective Dates
fields.value: With Premium (Conditional Receipt may apply): Date all underwriting requirements are met; Without Premium: 28 days following underwriting approval date

fields.name: Free Look Period
fields.value: Insured has 30 days to review policy and if desired, return it for a full refund

fields.name: Policy Delivery
fields.value: Policy Delivery Receipt (PDR) must be signed within 30 days of Policy Approval Date

fields.value: Metropolitan Life Insurance Company, New York, NY 10166
